title: Ticket #784: File paths containing commas don't work with Condor-C
description:
A job whose executable or stdin/out/err filename contains a comma doesn't work properly with Condor-C. The comma must be in the path, not the file basename, to cause an error. When the remote schedd rewrites these attributes after file stage-in, it treats them as lists of files delimited by commas.

Here's a submit file that demonstrates the bug: 

universe = grid
grid_resource = condor nostos.cs.wisc.edu condor.cs.wisc.edu
executable = foo,bar/bug.sh
should_transfer_files = YES
when_to_transfer_output = ON_EXIT
queue
